subtitle: [Music]
Thinking Allowed. Conversations on the
leading edge of knowledge and discovery with
psychologist Jeffrey Mishlove.
Hello and welcome. I'm Jeffrey Mishlove.
Today we are going to explore the nature
of the afterlife.
With me is Dr. Stafford Betty, a
philosopher and professor of religious
studies at California State University in
Bakersfield.
Stafford is author of The Afterlife
Unveiled and Heaven and Hell
Unveiled, as well as a novel, The Imprisoned
Splendor, based on a description of the afterlife,
and a philosophical treatise, Vadiraj's
Refutation Of
Sankara's Non Dualism. Welcome, Stafford.
Great to be here. Thanks for the
invitation, Jeff. You are most welcome.
It's a pleasure for me to be with you
too. When we think about the after-life
there are many lines of evidence
one could point to: near-death experiences,
mediumistic communications,
religious doctrines. How do you approach it?
I am more attracted to mediumistic communications.
Because I look at the
scriptures of the world's religions
and I think of them not as coming from some higher
plane, through some sort of godly realm, I
just don't see them that way. They all
seem man-made to me.
What they have to say about the world beyond
differs considerably one from another.
I am looking for
better evidence, something that's more plausible,
something I can rely on more. I find that
especially by looking at the near-death experience
and by looking at mediumistic
communications from the other side.
It seems to me that what comes forth
from these kinds of evidence
seems more plausible, certainly more inspiring
and something I want to share with
the world and that's why I write these books.
Psychic researchers have been
studying mediums and mediumistic
communication going back
to about the 1850s. We have over 150
years of research
at this point in time. Although, I think
there's still a lot of disagreement amongst
the researchers themselves as to how
reliable this material is.
Yeah, there is.
I think that the deeper one goes
into the subject the more reliable it's
going to seem.
I'm one of the persons who has gone
most deeply into the subject.
What I've done is to analyze and bring together
dozens and dozens, perhaps as many as a hundred
different communications from the other side
that purport to describe the
world in which they live.
I find this a lot more believable and plausible
than a scripture which purports to tell
us what is on the other side but it's
not written by somebody who's there.
I want a witness who
can speak to me with more authority
and that's what we're getting. I get the sense that some of these
scriptures are written for the purpose
of getting people to behave.
Right. That is correct and there isn't
that kind of
orientation or there isn't that kind of
urge in this
group. If anything, what comes through
from the communicators themselves is that we think
that you materialists, you non-believers
have made a mistake.
There is something on the other side and
we want to tell you about it.
We think it's a mistake in every sense
for you to try to navigate through life
without the expectation and consolation
and the hope that there is more to life
than just this one life here.
A skeptic would typically counter by saying
that, well, of course people wish for an afterlife
and therefore all of these
descriptions are ultimately the
product of a sort of wish fulfillment. Right.
This is where you have to begin to
look for evidence. What is there about
these communications that makes you
think that they are legitimate
rather than just maybe a subconscious wish fulfillment on the
part of the medium?
It could well be that all of this material is coming from the
medium’s subconscious imagination. That
is a possibility and I allow that
is a possibility.
I don't think it's a very likely possibility.
The reason I don't—there are a number of reasons for that—but the main
one is that some of the best communications have
told us a great
deal about the memories of a deceased person
that check out.
Memories that the medium knows nothing but
that the person who is alleged
to be coming through
would be expected to know about because
he or she is describing his or her life
and is remembering his or her life.
These allegations, these
memories, can be checked. Are they factual?
In the best of instances they are
impressively factual.
In the very best of instances dozens and
dozens of very specific accounts
have been matched with what
survivors who knew them well
remember about them. In some instances
you'll even find descriptions of where a
forgotten will was placed in a book in the library
of the deceased person. How is the
medium going to know about that information?
It checks out, there is the will. There have
been book tests.
There have been cross correspondences, ways to
check a medium's authenticity. All I can
say is that the more you look into this material
the more likely you're going to be convinced. I
recall reading an issue of the magazine of the
Smithsonian Institute of 1903
surveying at that time, over a hundred years
ago, the literature
for psychical research on survival after death.
They concluded that, well, we're not
a hundred percent sure about survival but if
nothing else this literature
conclusively establishes the existence
of extrasensory perception.
Yes, it does.
A contemporary materialist would be
equally unhappy with both.
You’re right. It's called super ESP.
There is a possibility. I think this
is really going out on a limb. Let me tell you this, Jeff.
I think it's going way out on a limb
but it's possible
that in the case that I just described
that the medium
would somehow have the super ESP ability
to know exactly where that will was located in
that particular book in that man's library.
That would be clairvoyance
that is just harder for me to believe
than the relatively more plausible theory,
that no, it's somebody's memory who's coming through and we would expect him
to know where the will was.
In either case you’re dealing with
some level of paranormal phenomena that
suggests that we need to take a deeper
look at nature. But
let's assume for the moment that
as a working hypothesis that the spiritualist
literature from the great mediums, at
least the best of it, is authentic. Then the
interesting question is, if
they're describing the afterlife,
what are the commonalities, what are
the patterns, what is the afterlife
really like at least according to them?
It would be worth,
I think even for people who don't accept
the legitimacy of this literature might
like to know what it is they're saying
in any case before they reject it. That's right. They
might be attracted to it even
because the world that is described,
the world that we will be entering at
death they claim, that world
doesn't exist way out on one of
the rings of Saturn, it’s
right around us. When I first came across that
claim I was really rather
astounded because we don't see
anything of this world. That's because we
don't have the capacity to. They can see us
but we can't see them. We share
a common space. There are clairvoyants
who claim they can see. That is true. I’ve had
clairvoyant women—they’ve all been women—in my
classes who tell me matter of factly, “Yes,
Dr. Betty, I can see spirits.” They do see, I
believe. There's no reason to think
that they're lying.
They're not trying for a better grade,
they kind of come up
and tell me on the side privately,
they don't want anybody else in the class to know that they have these
talents. I've talked to any number of people who
have this ability.
So you can see this world of spirit
around you. Their world interpenetrates ours.
But it goes outward. It is as if the
world, or our earth is the core of this
space. When you look upward to heaven you're doing something that is really
rather correct because
the worlds of spirit go outward from
the center, which is our earth, and the
higher you go
the more advanced, the more evolved are the realms
and the more light filled and the more
indescribable they become with the
English language. When you say the higher they go
you don't mean in physical distance from
the Earth, do you?
Maybe. I'm not sure but it seems that way.
But we don't have to go that way
but it seems that way.
They speak of higher spheres. Now, what do you mean by higher?
Are we to take that literally?
We don't have to. But there is the
reference to higher, more evolved
spheres, where more advanced souls go. You use the term
astral plane.
In my understanding the astral
plane is sort of a medieval notion. It
comes from a time when it was believed that
each of the planets
of astronomy represented almost a glass
sphere that encircled the earth, that
there were these seven
spheres and the earth was at the center.
Of course that's a cosmology that's
been refuted by science but has
remained in spiritual traditions to
the extent that we still
call it the astral plane. We do, that's right.
If in fact we are sharing space with the deceased,
what can we say? It doesn't seem as if…
This is a common description. The closer
you are to earth the less evolved you are.
What follows from that is that as you move away
from being an earthbound soul, stuck in your old
patterns, stuck in your
alcoholism, stuck in whatever your addiction is,
as you move away from those kinds of habits
do you move upward and outward? That's
the way it seems as I read this literature.
But I don't want to insist on that at all. After all, it might be
some sort of higher dimensional space in which the
parameter we’re talking about is not up or down as
we think of it in physical space. I
like that. Thank you very
much, Jeff. That's consistent with what
they say. That’s another way to look at it.
That brings us to what the world
that they describe is like. First of all,
it's remarkably similar.
It's not as if you're getting a picture of
some Chinese version of an afterlife
and then you get another Hindu version
of an afterlife, and you get another Muslim
version. You're getting
the same basic picture from these
various sources, from these various communicators
which leads me to believe that it's
not likely that we're dealing with hallucination.
I can't rule out that possibility but
it's not likely. It seems to me that
because they are describing something
more or less the same way
they are in contact with a reality
that they all share.
What that world is that they share
is of no little interest to me and
should be of great interest to
anyone, it seems to me. Why?
Why should we care? Why should we care?
First of all, if we believe
that our life here is the only
life that we know that
casts a kind of gloom over what death means.
We look at death and we think, oh, this is
a bummer, we cease to exist.
Most people don't like the idea of
ceasing to exist.
I certainly don't. So if we can
find evidence that there is more to
life than just this planetary life and
we see it actually described in an attractive and plausible way
that really determines to a certain
extent how we feel about death. How we feel about death has a lot to do with
how we feel about our lives.
So I am very happy to describe in my books what
these spirits are in agreement in their
descriptions. I know you have about 50 different
things, descriptors. Nifty fifty. Right. That is correct.
There are many many things that can be said.
Where would you like me to start?
How about at the moment of death. At the
moment of death you will find yourself gravitating
quite naturally, without any effort on
your part, to a sector of the afterlife—
I think that's the best word— where you will find spirits
of like development and like mind.
If you are a Roman Catholic,
say a very conservative Roman
Catholic, you’re going to find yourself gravitating to people who
in this life were conservative Roman
Catholics. They will embrace you and take you in
and you'll be one of them and you'll be
comfortable.
That's where it will begin. There are
many many sectors.
You'll gravitate not only to the
proper sector horizontally, you will gravitate
also to the proper sector vertically. Now
we're talking about
dark realms at the bottom and light
filled realms at the very top. Depending on
your karma, depending on the kind of being you have
formed yourself into by the choices you've made,
habitually made, that will determine at least
where your afterlife starts.
Horizontally it starts according to the sector
and then vertically what
matters is the kind of human being you
are. If you are a selfish cruel person you're
not going to find yourself comfortable in a light filled environment.
You're going to find yourself
comfortable among people who are like you
in a darker realm. These realms are
described in detail unanimously by all of these
communicators.
All of them affirm that there is a dark
world, that there are dark environments.
But these worlds are never described as hell
without ending. They are hellish.
But they are places where one can move
out of and there's plenty of help to
anyone who wants to move
out of these realms. There are people
from the light, from the heavenly realms, who are
delighted to go down
and serve in any way they can. One of
the ways to serve is to go down into
these dark realms and try to help these people
out of their misery. Do you have the
converse? Do you have
beings move from the dark realm who try to
reach up to the lighter realms and
pull others down? They can't. But where
they can reach is to our realm and they do.
There are so many descriptions in this literature
of the earthbound spirit,
for example the alcoholic spirit. An alcoholic
finds himself thinking of the booze,
thinking of the liquor that he's missing
desperately because
he still is an addicted being, he
still loves liquor. Nothing happens just
because he dies.
He wants liquor. He gravitates quite naturally
back to earth and finds himself
in a bar in San Francisco and
here's a guy drinking gin. So this spirit attaches
itself and tries to drink and enjoy the gin
through the living person whom he's attached to.
This is one way that we
can be undone by spiritual presences.
These are what are known as
earthbound spirits. These are earthbound spirits.
But there is another kind and these are the truly demonic spirits.
There are not that many. But there are
demonic spirits who are—again, this comes through
the communicators themselves—
you might say, whose mission is to make as much
misery for us as they can.
That gives them joy. That's what gives
them a sense of success.
There are many ways that shamans have told us
how to protect ourselves from these
beings. I see. In that
sense, in acknowledging the existence of
the demonic it seems there's some overlap between
the teachings that come through spirit mediums and
traditional religious theology. That is
true. You find references to
the demonic in Hinduism, it's all over
the place. You find it of course in Christianity. You find it not much in
Judaism but there's a little of it
in Buddhism. You find these
demonic beings in almost
all of the great religious traditions.
But in other regards there are many
differences between theology
and spiritual teachings. Great differences. Very much so.
The conviction that some people have,
particularly Protestant Christians have,
that what saves you is acquiescence in a formula.
“I take Jesus as my lord and savior.”
That's going to get you
nowhere according to these communicators.
Faith alone is not enough. It's only the
beginning.
If faith leads to a virtuous life,
to a good life, then great. But if it
doesn't, it's worthless.
Deathbed conversions will take you nowhere,
the spirits claim because you can't fool
the universe. You are
who you are and you will gravitate naturally to
the proper realm.
If you've been a cruel
and dark soul that's where you’re
going to find yourself, at least to start with.
After this first starting phase, then what?
There are ways to progress.
The way to progress at every level,
from the darker to the more light filled
realms is to recognize
that you have fallen short, that you want
to be a better person, that you could have done a better job,
that you wish you had done a better job.
You recognize your deficiency.
Then you give yourself, with the instructions of
your spirit guide,
this is how you can better yourself.
There are all kinds of ways to be of service.
Here's a way I can help you better yourself and evolve in your own right.
Go down into the dark realm and check on
this particular soul. You remember your
mother-in-law?
She's a person who is in a dark place
right now. You can help her out
of her misery. Go down there and try
to reason with her, let her know that she’s
loved, let her know that it's possible to
move out of where she’s stuck. What is a
spirit guide?
A spirit guide is a former human being,
probably long deceased, who has
evolved enough to give guidance to
those who have newly come over.
They have a certain wisdom about them
and a more advanced love and a better tolerance
for difficult challenges. That's
how they become guides.
Many references in this literature say
that each of us has at least one,
guardian angels and all that
business. They're called
spirit guides or spirit guardians in
this literature. We all have one or
two or even more until we show them that we
have no interest in the help
they're trying to give.
At that point we can be deserted and
that's a calamitous position to find ourselves in.
This is what the communicators are telling us.
This and so much more. It's a fascinating
world. As you point out you have 50
different descriptors.
The literature is extraordinarily rich.
It is extraordinarily rich.
It is amazing to me that most of the books
that I have enjoyed and learned from
are out of print.
A few of them are very much in print but
most of them were published 100 ago,
50 years ago, great stuff. I brought it all
together and found the commonalities and what
I'm saying is based on those commonalities.
I know that some of this literature you’ve
decided to discount.
You don't take it all at face value. I
don’t. Some of it strikes me as
basically borrowed. It's not full of surprises.
A good afterlife account is going to
leave me feeling surprised because
I have never been there, I don't
remember it if I have been there.
If I'm not surprised it's probably because
some hack or some fraud has brought together the information
that I've done and that others have done like me
and decided to make a buck out of it and
put it together and pretended to
have a medium, or say that he
is a medium and has a spirit named such-
and-such who was telling her all about
is. There are frauds like that in this literature, unfortunately.
I gather you’re looking at, in many cases,
mediums who've worked extensively with psychical researchers over
decades, people who have been known to be of high
integrity. Exactly.
Many of them have high reputations. Many
of them were British aristocrats, women who didn't
have much else to do with their time
except to work with these scientists
but discovered they had an ability to
be good mediums and they delighted in working with these scientists. It gave
them something to do
and they became very good at it and they
were people of impeccable reputation,
as were the scientists who worked with
them. We have less than two minutes but I'd like to ask you
briefly before we close our interview
about reincarnation. Reincarnation.
Yes, it's affirmed by most of the spirit
literature. Although not all. Not all. I think
the reason for that is that
if you have not believed in it, if you have
hated the very notion of it and you find
yourself in a Christian sector
and you want to come through a medium,
you still don't believe in reincarnation
even though it's all around you. As soon as you
move away from that sector
and discover what's really out there
you're probably going to
be convinced that there is reincarnation
because it’s affirmed,
not unanimously, but so broadly.
Why reincarnation? Because these
physical bodies that we have,
the dense brains that we’re sometimes cursed with,
the faulty memories, we are
challenged by this difficult environment.
The more we are challenged, the
more progress we can make in a shorter
amount of time. You mean here in a physical body is actually
a very good place for spiritual
development. Absolutely.
This is a spiritual gymnasium that we’re in.
We should make the best of
our time and we should remember
that the choices that we make have
consequences in the next world.
Stafford Betty, it's been a real pleasure
sharing this vision with me and with you
and with our viewers. Thank you so much
for being with me.
Delighted to be here. I'm honored.
Thank you for being with us.
[Music]
